I understand multivitamin, but don't know what the "tablet" is -- can you explain?Have you been to see your doctor?  Get your thyroid levels tested and also get your blood sugar levels tested.  Talk to your doctor about these things.

ok but wats the thyroid test all about, the only thing i know a thyroid is dat its a gland situate at the neck region, and has throxine and triodethyronine and also calcithonine and then deficiency of iodine leads to goiter, which it can be cut off if serious or one can get cretilism.so i dont know wat i should do to have a thyroid test but i can try a blood sugar test.

No, you have the thyroid idea wrong --- sometimes the thyroid malfunctions and produces either too much of thyroxine (T4) and/or triodethyronine (T3).  These hormones control your body temperature, your heart rate and your metabolism.  If your levels of these hormones is too high, you will not be able to gain weight, and in fact, may continue to lose weight.Aside from the weight issue, too much thyroid hormone can cause very rapid heart rate, raise your body temperature, cause fatigue, as well as other symptoms.  The tests you need to ask for are Free T4, Free T3, TSH, TPOab, TGab and TSI.A blood sugar test would measure the level of sugar in your blood -- a glucose tolerance test would be good........also a test called A1c, which measures what your blood sugar has ranged over a period of 2-3 months.  You might also want to ask for a test to check your insulin levels......if you would have diabetes (high blood sugar/not enough insulin) this could also cause weight loss or inability to gain...I know this is all confusing and I want to make sure that you understand -- I am not a doctor -- just a fellow person who has medical issues that cause weight problems.Since this is a Weight Loss and Dieting community, rather than a "medical" forum, please feel free to send me a PM and I will try to give you more information.I look forward to hearing from you.........
